IntroductionAPI

API

Creation

New propositions are created fluently created by initially calling overloads of the Spec.Build() method.

Method Description
Build() Initiates the build process based on a predicate or an existing proposition
As() (Optional) Defines a custom higher order proposition
AsAllSatisfied() (Optional) Defines a proposition that is satisfied when all
odels in the collection are satisfied
AsAnySatisfied() (Optional) Defines a proposition that is satisfied when any
of the models in the collection are satisfied
AsNoneSatisfied() (Optional) Defines a proposition that is satisfied when none
of the models in the collection are satisfied
AsAtLeastNSatisfied() (Optional) Defines a proposition that is satisfied when at least n
models in the collection are satisfied
AsAtMostNSatisfied() (Optional) Defines a proposition that is satisfied when no more than n
models in the collection are satisfied
AsNSatisfied() (Optional) Defines a proposition that is satisfied when n
number of models in the collection are satisfied
WhenTrue() (Optional) Defines the assertion when the proposition is satisfied
WhenTrueYield() (Optional) Defines a collection of assertions to return when
WhenFalse() (Optional) Defines the assertion when the proposition is not satisfied
WhenFalseYield() (Optional) Defines a collection of assertions to return when the proposition is not satisfied
Create() Completes the build process and returns the proposition

Operations

Propositions can be operated on to form new propositions.

Operator Syntax Description
And() left & right Performs a logical AND upon two propositions
AndAlso() left.AndAlso(right) Performs a short-circuiting logical AND upon two propositions
Or() left \| right Performs a logical OR upon two propositions
OrElse() left.OrElse(right) Performs a short-circuiting logical OR upon two propositions
XOr() left ^ right Performs a logical XOR upon two propositions
Not() !proposition Performs a logical NOT upon a proposition
